data.name: Joffrey Ballet: A Midsummer Night’s Dream
data.description: Far from a Shakespearean tale, Ekman’s ‘Midsummer Night’s Dream’ is a mind-bending trip to a surreal realm of unearthly delights. Set during the traditional Scandinavian summer solstice festival, dancers celebrate a day of revelry and romance under the maypole, which soon unravels into an otherworldly dream. Ekman’s picturesque fusion of classical and contemporary ballet blurs the line between the real and the imagined and makes us wonder, is it all a dream?

data.name: Bruce Liu
data.description: Following a meteoric rise “to rock-star status in the classical music world” (Globe and Mail) sparked by winning the 2021 International Chopin Piano Competition, Bruce Liu makes his much-anticipated Chicago debut. His program includes inventive keyboard compositions by Rameau, Kapustin, Haydn and Prokofiev, as well as Chopin’s Sonata No. 2 in B-flat Minor, with its famous funeral march at its structural and emotional heart.

data.name: Shaken, Not Stirred
data.description: Enjoy a concert featuring iconic music from the ageless James Bond movie franchise, including hits from Skyfall, Goldfinger, Diamonds Are Forever and more. John Morris Russell conducts the Chicago Symphony Orchestra alongside Broadway star and vocal powerhouse Capathia Jenkins in this salute to the notorious secret agent.Enhance your evening by purchasing a ticket package that includes a preconcert event with hors d’oeuvres stations and specialty drinks plus prime seating at the concert. Learn more and purchase a ticket package »This performance is part of the 33rd Annual Corporate Night, a fundraising event presented in partnership by the Chicago Symphony Orchestra Association and the League of the CSOA. Proceeds benefit the Chicago Symphony Orchestra’s artistic, educational and community engagement programs in Chicago and across the globe.

data.name: Tchaikovsky Pathétique & Trifonov
data.description: Lahav Shani conducts Tchaikovsky’s Pathétique, a symphony that the composer premiered less than a week before his death and was later nicknamed for the passion and suffering it expresses. Daniil Trifonov takes the spotlight in former CSO Mead Composer-in-Residence Mason Bates’ Piano Concerto, a journey through three stylistic sound worlds, from Renaissance dance music to Romantic-era brooding to a contemporary finale imbued with strains of jazz and minimalism.

data.name: Neil DeGrasse Tyson: An Astrophysicist Goes To The Movies
data.description: Join Neil deGrasse Tyson at his show– An Astrophysicist Goes to the Movies, The Sequel. Experience an entertaining and enlightening review of all the science some of our favorite movies got wrong – or right.

data.name: How I Learned What I Learned
data.description: Broadway In Chicago is excited to join Congo Square Theatre Company in announcing its continued 25th Anniversary celebration with the Chicago premiere of HOW I LEARNED WHAT I LEARNED, August Wilson’s autobiographical show. Directed by Ken-Matt Martin and featuring Chicago’s own Harry Lennix, this limited engagement will run from April 20 – May 5, 2024 at Broadway In Chicago’s Broadway Playhouse at Water Tower Place (175 E. Chestnut St).HOW I LEARNED WHAT I LEARNED follows Wilson’s journey as a young Black writer from Pittsburgh to one of the most celebrated American playwrights of the 20th century. Written three years before his death, the one-man show recounts numerous stories from the author’s long career and the lessons they taught about what it means to be a Black artist in America.

data.name: Jon Meacham: The Call to Serve
data.description: Pulitzer Prize-winning historian Jon Meacham is a New York Times bestselling author of a long list of acclaimed presidential biographies. He presents Chicago Humanities with his latest work, The Call of Serve: The Life of An American President, George Herbert Walker Bush: A Visual Biography. In this recounting, gleaned from a lifetime of Bush family scrapbooks, Meacham curates a balanced personal view into an American president and man who was more than politics. With over 450 never-before-published photos and intimate memories to reference from his visually stunning book, Meacham frames the forty-first president’s vision of leadership as a service to his country.

data.name: Gino's East
data.description:
Gino's East is a deep-dish pizza restaurant chain founded in Chicago in 1966. It is known for its thick, buttery crust and generous toppings. Gino's East has several locations in Chicago and the surrounding suburbs, as well as in other cities across the United States.

Gino's East pizza is made with fresh, high-quality ingredients. The dough is made from scratch daily and the sauce is made with fresh tomatoes and herbs. The pizzas are topped with a variety of meats, cheeses, and vegetables.

Gino's East pizza is cooked in a deep dish, which is a type of baking pan with high sides. This allows the pizza to cook evenly and prevents the crust from becoming soggy. The deep dish also allows for more toppings to be added to the pizza.

Gino's East pizza is a popular choice for locals and tourists alike. It is known for its delicious flavor and its hearty portions. Gino's East pizza is a great option for a casual meal or a special occasion.

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.

data.name: Mariah the Scientist and DJ Honey
Annual Race Against Gun Violence
data.description: On Thursday, June 6, Strides for Peace will host its Annual Race Against Gun Violence in Chicago’s Grant Park. The Race Against Gun Violence was created in 2018 to build a new platform to support community organizations and bring people together around the shared vision of a Chicago free from the fear of gun violence. Past race sponsors include JP Morgan Chase & Co., Advocate Aurora Health, Blue Cross Blue Shield, Chicago CRED, HISCOX, Southland Rise, and more.The Race Against Gun Violence raises unrestricted funds and awareness of the work being done day-by-day by grassroots organizations across the city to build a Chicago where all can thrive. It offers a one-of-a-kind opportunity to choose hope, celebrate the progress we are making together, and bring out the best of our city.To date, over 30 community organizations have committed to participating in this year’s Race Against Gun Violence, including BUILD, CAASE, Challenge II Change, C.H.A.M.P.S. data.name: Chicago Shakespeare Theater: Judgment Day
data.description: “Landing all the jokes… Moritz von Stuelpnagel tackles darkly funny materials with a shrewd balance of heightened reality, warped sitcom & underlying pathos”–Hollywood ReporterEmmy and Tony Award-winner Jason Alexander (of Seinfeld fame) makes his Chicago stage debut in a hilariously irreverent world premiere comedy staged by Broadway director Moritz von Stuelpnagel and written by award-winning TV screenwriter Rob Ulin. Alexander plays Sammy Campo, a staggeringly corrupt, morally bankrupt lawyer who’s threatened with eternal damnation by a terrifying angel after a near-death experience. In a desperate attempt to redeem himself, Sammy forms an unlikely bond with a Catholic priest who is having his own crisis of faith. Filled with razor-sharp wit, this deliciously devious comedy rollicks through the timeless questions of Western philosophy—“morality,” “faith,” and “Are people any damn good?”

data.name: Brick of Chicago Old Town Neighborhood Walking Tour
data.description: On a Brick of Chicago neighborhood walking tour, you’ll learn about all the elements that make Chicago one of the most interesting and dynamic cities in the world. Afterwards, you’ll never look at the built world (or the humble brick) the same way again!Brick of Chicago neighborhood walking tours have been voted one of Chicago’s best tours by Curbed and the Chicago Reader.Old Town is one of Chicago’s most unique neighborhoods, with a blend of Victorian workers cottages, unique midcentury buildings, and massive modern homes. First built up pre-fire by German immigrants, Old Town came to fame in the postwar years as a neighborhood of artists and preservation-minded homeowners – a complicated history that includes the destructive forces of fire and urban renewal, and the creative forces of eccentrics and star-chitects. Join this tour and you’ll never be able to see Old Town, Chicago, or the built world the same way again!After this tour you’ll never look at Chicago or the humble brick in the same way again!

data.name: Twin Anchors
data.description:
Twin Anchors is a historic and iconic barbecue restaurant located in Chicago, Illinois, celebrated for its mouthwatering ribs, classic atmosphere, and a rich history.

Twin Anchors is renowned for its delectable barbecue ribs. These ribs are slow-cooked to perfection and slathered in a signature sauce, delivering a flavorful and tender dining experience.

The restaurant provides a classic and timeless atmosphere, with a cozy interior and vintage decor. It's a place where you can step back in time and enjoy a taste of old-school Chicago.

Twin Anchors has a rich history dating back to the 1930s and is often associated with the famous clientele it has served over the years, including celebrities and politicians.
The restaurant typically offers a full bar with a selection of cocktails and beverages that pair well with their barbecue dishes.

Twin Anchors in Chicago is a destination for those seeking classic barbecue ribs and a taste of Chicago's history. Whether you are a barbecue enthusiast, a history buff, or simply looking for a delicious and nostalgic meal, this restaurant promises a memorable dining experience.

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.

data.name: entre horizontes: Art and Activism Between Chicago and Puerto Rico
data.description:
"entre horizontes: Art and Activism Between Chicago and Puerto Rico" examines the artistic genealogies and social justice movements that connect Puerto Rico with Chicago. Featuring works by an intergenerational group of artists with ties to Chicago, the exhibition presents Puerto Rican painters who use printmaking techniques and approaches alongside artists who address social and political issues through their work.

The exhibition also centers Chicago as a city that for decades has championed national conversations on Puerto Rican self-determination and Latine issues, such as immigration and bilingual education. It features a selection of materials documenting the social movements and community organizations that advocated for the rights of underrepresented Latine communities, including historic photographs and other ephemera that tell the story of the anticolonial resistance and transcultural solidarities in the Puerto Rican community in Chicago.

data.name: Museum of Contemporary Art
data.description:
Enter a world where creativity knows no bounds at the Museum of Contemporary Art in Chicago. 

Unleash your imagination as you step into a playground of artistic expression that pushes the boundaries of tradition and be mesmerized by cutting-edge installations that challenge the status quo, sparking conversations that ripple through the art world. 

Marvel at contemporary masterpieces by renowned artists such as Andy Warhol and Frida Kahlo, reveling in the ever-evolving tapestry of modern art. 

Prepare to have your senses awakened and your perspective forever transformed in this pulsating hub of artistic evolution.

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.

data.name: Millennium Park
data.shortDescription: Millennium Park in downtown Chicago is a must-visit with its iconic attractions like Cloud Gate and Crown Fountain, free concerts, and beautiful gardens.
data.description:
Step into a world of artistic marvels, green spaces, and unforgettable experiences. 

Millennium Park is an unmissable place for anyone visiting Chicago; take a selfie with the iconic "Bean" sculpture, officially known as Cloud Gate, marvel at the distorted reflections of the city skyline and indulge in a leisurely stroll through picturesque gardens and beautifully manicured landscapes. 

Be captivated by jaw-dropping performances at the Jay Pritzker Pavilion, a stunning outdoor concert venue. Cool off in Crown Fountain, where giant LED screens display a mesmerizing water feature. 

An urban oasis in the heart of Chicago, With its art installations, cultural events, and breathtaking views, Millennium Park is the ultimate destination.

data.name: Sensory-Friendly Morning
data.description: About the EventJoin us for Sensory Friendly Morning and join Bodies of Work and Hubbard Street Dance Company with art making activities and movement exercises for all bodies and abilities.Sensory-Friendly Morning is a free program for all people who benefit from visiting the MCA without large crowds and other sensitive environmental elements. This includes visitors with sensory sensitivities, disabilities, autism, PTSD, dementia, and more. On these mornings, lighting at the museum is dimmed, sounds from artworks and environmental noise is kept at a minimum, and a quiet space is available to visitors for breaks. During Sensory-Friendly Mornings, preregistered individuals and their families can visit the museum to explore exhibitions at their own pace.Sensory-Friendly Morning aims to be a welcoming space to experience contemporary art in a judgment-free environment.

data.name: Chicago Dance Month 2024’S Pier Dance
data.description: CHICAGO – See Chicago Dance, the dance industry’s nonprofit service organization,is proud to announce that its popular annual offering, Chicago Dance Month, returns this June. Now in its 12th year, Chicago Dance Month provides numerous opportunities for artists and companies to celebrate the myriad talents that make Chicago’s dance scene so strong. This summer celebration, featuring many free events, begins with See Chicago Dance hosting a preview of performers and performances with a Chicago Dance Month Kick-Off Celebration, Saturday, June 1 at 3 p.m. at Navy Pier, 600 E. Grand Ave. and “Pier Dance” at Navy Pier throughout June. More information may be found at SeeChicagoDance.com. “Chicago Dance Month is how See Chicago Dance introduces hundreds of dance lovers and casual fans to new performers and reconnects them with established audience favorites. It’s an amazing cross-section of Chicago’s incredible and dynamic dance community,” said See Chicago Dance Executive Director Julia Mayer. “Chicago Dance Month, and the programs we’ll present throughout the rest of the summer, offer people of all ages and skill levels countless opportunities–most of them free–to discover a new dance company or performer, a new dance style, a new culture. There is no place better than Chicago in the summer. And there is no better way to discover Chicago than through dance!” Participants may enjoy free dance lessons at the Navy Pier’s City Stage every Wednesday in June. These sessions are great for those who love socializing, learning new dances and being outdoors. 2024 “Pier Dance” companies include: June 5: Balboa with Jamila Kekulah Kinney (Balboa – Partner dance)June 12: Bollywood with Meher Dance Company (Bollywood)June 19: “Contemporary Groove” with Megan Rhodes (Contemporary Dance)June 26: Salsa & Rueda Casino with Eduardo Zambrano (Partnered Dance and Dance Circle).

Sackler Center for Feminist Art at the Brooklyn Museum, and Iris Colburn, MCA Curatorial Associate.Please note that Courtney Martin is no longer able to participate.English and Spanish CART captioning and American Sign Language (ASL) will be provided.

data.name: A.B.L.E. presents The Odyssey
data.description: Set sail for an adventure like no other, full of twists and turns. Together we’ll meet indulgent Lotus Eaters and seductive Sirens who test our focus, and face terrifying monsters who test our wit and our courage. As we follow Odysseus on his Journey, the ensemble reflects on choice and agency and the hero in all of us. A.B.L.E.—Artists Breaking Limits & Expectations—a Chicago-based nonprofit that creates theatre and film for, with, and by individuals with Down syndrome and other intellectual and developmental disabilities (I/DD), is thrilled to return to Chicago Shakespeare Theater with a re-imagining of the epic classic The Odyssey. A.B.L.E’s production weaves music, movement, shadow puppetry, and scenes devised by the group into a powerful and joyful celebration of the choices we make, and the challenges we face along our journey. The vibrant adaptation features a neurodiverse cast of 44 performers, including 24 actors with intellectual and developmental disabilities. The performance in the Courtyard Theater on May 11, 2024 at 2pm will mark the two companies’ 7th collaboration, most recently having co-produced A Midsummer Night’s Dream last spring. Accessibility at this performanceOpen captioningDual ASL interpretationRelaxed performance, including a designated movement zoneSensory SupportWheelchair AccessMasks required out of consideration for our immunocompromised community members Ticket TiersAll tickets are general admission. ABLE is committed to removing barriers, and that includes ensuring our work is financially accessible for everyone who wants to attend. Pick the pricing tier that works for you:$15 – I am ABLE to connect – this level represents ABLE’s commitment to making the arts accessible for all.$30 – I am ABLE to contribute – this level helps offset crucial production costs like props, costumes, and rehearsal space.$45 – I am ABLE to create – this level represents the true cost of A.B.L.E.’s programming. If everyone purchased a ticket at this level, we would break even for this semester.

data.name: #OTVTonight: A Window Into Love
data.description: About the EventLove is a universal language; it transcends identity and culture. Love is more than a feeling; it is a tough invitation that encourages sacrifice and commitment. Love is a never-ending journey that is always beginning. But what is love in the absence of compassion and wonder? #OTVTonight, your favorite intersectional Late Show, returns to MCA Chicago for an intimate evening filled with care and admiration for the stories that help us to cultivate a bond that is strong enough to heal, prepare, and transform unstable foundations.Join us in the Edlis Neeson Theater for the premiere of handpicked titles inviting us to open a window into love, interspersed with artist interviews, live DJ sets, pop-up performances and more — all hosted by OTV’s Co-Founder and Executive Diva, Elijah McKinnon. Remember, the future of television is intersectional. If you don’t believe it, let OTV show you.For live updates on #OTVTonight: A Window Into Love, visit bit.ly/otvtonight.

The Duck Inn is famous for its duck specialties, including duck fat fries, duck confit, and a renowned duck hot dog, which offers a unique twist on classic comfort food.

The restaurant boasts a selection of craft cocktails that complement the food perfectly. The innovative drink menu adds to the dining experience.

The restaurant typically provides a laid-back yet upscale atmosphere, making it a versatile choice for a casual dinner or a special occasion.

The Duck Inn in Chicago offers a culinary journey focusing on duck specialties, creative American cuisine, and craft cocktails. If you are a food enthusiast or looking for a unique dining experience, this restaurant provides a delicious and inventive approach to dining.

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.

data.name: Adler Planetarium
data.description:
Blast off into a celestial adventure at the Adler Planetarium! 

Get ready to embark on a cosmic journey through galaxies, stars, and beyond diving into the secrets of the universe as you explore interactive exhibits that reveal the wonders of space. 

Strap in for a thrilling virtual reality mission to the moon, experiencing weightlessness and the thrill of discovery and marvel at the mesmerizing planetarium shows, where constellations come to life and you can almost touch the Milky Way. 

Prepare to have your mind blown as you become a space explorer in this captivating celestial playground.

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.

data.name: Shedd Aquarium
data.description:
The Shedd Aquarium in Chicago is a world-renowned attraction that offers a perfect family experience. 

Located on the iconic Lake Michigan shoreline, it showcases a remarkable variety of aquatic species and mesmerizing exhibits: from playful dolphins to majestic beluga whales, guests can witness the wonders of the underwater world. 

In addition to the breathtaking exhibits, the aquarium provides educational programs, interactive touch exhibits, and daily animal presentations, ensuring an engaging and informative visit for families. 

With its child-friendly layout and hands-on activities, it encourages curiosity, learning, and a deep appreciation for marine life. 

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.

data.name: Field Museum
data.description:
Journey into a world where curiosity reigns supreme at the Field Museum. 

Prepare to embark on an extraordinary adventure through time, nature, and culture. Roam the halls of this magnificent institution and be captivated by larger-than-life dinosaurs that transport you back to prehistoric eras. 

Discover the secrets of ancient civilizations as you explore meticulously preserved artifacts from around the globe and feel your heart race as you stand face-to-face with a towering T. rex, letting your imagination soar as you gaze upon glittering gemstones and awe-inspiring mummies. 

This playground of knowledge and wonder sparks the inner explorer in all who enter, ensuring an unforgettable journey of discovery.

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.

data.name: Chinatown
data.description:
Step into the vibrant tapestry of culture and cuisine in Chicago's Chinatown, a must-visit gem in the city's rich cultural landscape. 

Immersed in the sights, sounds, and flavors of the East, Chinatown offers a mesmerizing blend of traditions, history, and culinary delights and lose yourself in the bustling streets adorned with ornate Chinese architecture and vibrant red lanterns. 

Immerse yourself in cultural festivals that celebrate the Lunar New Year with vibrant parades and traditional performances and discover a world within a city, where East truly meets West, making Chinatown an unmissable destination that will leave you enchanted and craving for more.

data.name: Ping Tom Memorial Park
data.description:
Welcome to Ping Tom Memorial Park, an urban retreat nestled along the scenic Chicago River. 

Step into a haven of tranquility, where lush green spaces, stunning river views, and cultural tapestries converge and take a leisurely stroll along the riverfront trails, immersing yourself in the beauty of nature. 

Marvel at the iconic Chinatown skyline, framed against the backdrop of the serene waterways, fire up the grill at the picnic areas and enjoy a delightful feast with family and friends. Immerse yourself in the vibrant culture and traditions with art installations, cultural celebrations, and live performances. 

Whether you're seeking a peaceful escape or an exciting day out, Ping Tom Memorial Park offers an inviting sanctuary that will captivate your senses and leave you longing for more.

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.

data.name: Chess Records: Private Tour and Reception at Chicago’s legendary recording studio
data.description: Join Amy Bizzarri, author of the Best Hits on the Blues Highway, for an afternoon reception and private tour of iconic Chess Records benefiting Willie Dixon’s Blues Heaven FoundationWhere: Chess Records, 2120 S. Michigan Ave., ChicagoWhen: Sunday, May 26, 3-5pmTickets: $60/per person; includes a private tour of Chess Records, a copy of the book Best Hits on the Blues Highway, and light refreshments.All event proceeds support the Blues Heaven Foundation.The legendary Blues Highway has played a key role in the lives of countless musicians. Running from Nashville, Tennessee, to New Orleans, Louisiana, there’s music around every bend. From the two-room home where “the King” was born to the original Heartbreak Hotel to the crossroads where Robert Johnson allegedly sold his soul to the devil for fame, every stop has a story to tell. Inspiring, practical, and entertaining, The Best Hits on the Blues Highway is the premier guide to all the off-the-radar stops along America’s Blues Highway that you simply must not miss. Author Amy Bizzarri, road trip expert and author of the bestselling guide to the Mother Road, The Best Hits on Route 66, provides a comprehensive list of 100 unique stops that you’ll want to take a moment to explore as you journey along the fascinating, 730-mile route from Nashville to New Orleans.To celebrate the release of The Best Hits on the Blues Highway, Chicago-based author Amy Bizzarri is hosting an afternoon reception featuring private tours of Chicago’s Iconic Chess Records. Tickets are $60/per personand include a private tour of Chess Records, a copy of the book Best Hits on the Blues Highway, and light refreshments.Founded in Chicago by brothers Phil and Leonard Chess in 1950, Chess Records recorded some of the most beloved LPs in music history. In addition to bringing the Blues of Muddy Waters, Etta James, Chuck Berry, Willie Dixon, Bo Diddley, John Lee Hooker, and Howlin’ Wolf to the world’s attention, the label shaped the future of American-born music by inspiring and recording songs by rock and roll artists, including The Rolling Stones, who recorded 2120 South Michigan Avenue, a song named after Chess Records address, at the storied studio in June 1964.Event proceeds will benefit Willie Dixon’s Blues Heaven Foundation, whose mission is to help artists and musicians obtain what is rightfully theirs and to educate both adults and children on the history of the blues and the business of music.

Qing Xiang Yuan Dumplings
data.description:
Qing Xiang Yuan Dumplings is a popular eatery located in Chicago, Illinois, celebrated for its authentic Chinese dumplings, hand-pulled noodles, and a welcoming, no-frills atmosphere.

Qing Xiang Yuan Dumplings is renowned for its delicious and authentic Chinese dumplings. These dumplings are typically handmade and come in various flavors, from classic pork and cabbage to creative options like shrimp and chive.

In addition to dumplings, the restaurant often offers hand-pulled noodles that are freshly prepared and pair perfectly with their savory broths and sauces.

The restaurant typically provides a no-frills, casual dining experience, focusing on the quality and flavors of its dishes.

Qing Xiang Yuan Dumplings also offers vegetarian and vegan dumpling and noodle options, ensuring that there's something for everyone.

The restaurant is known for its affordability, making it a favorite among locals and students looking for a tasty and budget-friendly meal.

Qing Xiang Yuan Dumplings in Chicago is the go-to place for those craving authentic Chinese dumplings and hand-pulled noodles in a laid-back setting. 

For more information on reservations and prices, consult its official website.
